title: Edison Engineer (EEDP)
description: Leading the development of a centralized **Dependency Management Platform** to visualize and remediate vulnerabilities across 10,000+ proprietary libraries, directly impacting the security posture of GE's flagship imaging modalities.

Architected a scalable graph database solution (Neo4j/NetworkX) to map complex dependency trees across C, Java, and Python microservices, replacing manual spreadsheets and reducing audit capability time from weeks to minutes.

Designed and deployed a full-stack comparison engine using Angular and Flask that highlights granular version changes (added/removed/modified) between builds, enabling 5+ engineering teams to rapidly perform root-cause analysis on regression defects.
Accelerated software release cycles by **30%** by automating the detection of circular dependencies and deprecated packages, ensuring strictly compliant build artifacts for FDA-regulated releases.

title: Early Identification (EID) Intern
description: Engineered an enterprise-grade **Compliance RAG Automation** system to streamline the answering of complex hospital RFPs, reducing manual effort for marketing executives by **60%**.
Built a high-performance retrieval pipeline using **LangChain** and **ChromaDB**, indexing over 10,000 pages of unstructured policy documents, technical manuals, and compliance certificates.
Implemented a custom semantic search algorithm blending TF-IDF and transformer-based dense embeddings to maximize retrieval accuracy for niche medical terminology.

Developed a Microsoft Office plugin that integrates directly into the executive workflow, providing real-time, context-aware answer suggestions and citation links via a local LLM inference engine (Ollama).
